intro: Brachystephanus yaudensis, commonly known as the Yaudé cactus, is a rare and unique plant native to the Amazon rainforest of Ecuador. It is a small, spineless cactus with a compact, rounded stem that often appears as a cluster of short, thick, greenish-gray tubercles. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers during the dry season, which are typically short-lived but attract various pollinators. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant adaptations in humid tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
